IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: MONIES ARE DISBURSED TO VARIOUS CHARITABLE, EDUCATIONAL, AND SCIENTIFIC ORGANIZATIONS.
IRS990.MissionDescription: The Thunderbirds Charities corporation conducts business in the State of Arizona serving as the host organization for the PGA TOUR event that is conducted annually in the Phoenix metropolitan area, and through donations to Arizona based organizations, providing assistance to families, children, and others in need and improving the overall quality of life of Arizona's communities.
IRS990.Description: Thunderbirds Charities made contributions in the amount of $2,776,809 with total expenses of $23,561. The following is the summary of donations to the various 501(c)(3) organizations: 1) At-Risk Youth & Families: 1 organization for a total of $112,000 for capital projects & 20 organizations for a total of $437,000 for program funding, 2) Community Outreach/Quality of Life: 6 organizations for a total of $690,977 for capital projects & 17 organizations for a total of $262,000 for program funding, 3) Domestic Violence/Homeless/Poverty: 11 organizations for a total of $310,212 for program funding, 4) Education: 10 organizations for a total of $330,320 for program funding. 5) Improving the Lives of the Physically & Mentally Challenged: 5 organizations at $267,300 for capital project & 19 organizations for a total of $367,000 for program funding.

Activity2.Description: Birdies for Charity program Is a two part program designed to generate donations to local non-profit organizations. The Corporate Partner program accepts donations designated for specific charities from major sponsors of the FBR Open. Thunderbirds Charities provides 50% matching funds to these charities, up to a maximum of $12,500. The Birdie program allows local non-profit organizations to collect pledges based on the number of birdies made during the FBR Open. Thunderbirds Charities provides all materials for the pledge drives and collects the pledges after the event. Thunderbirds Charities then adds 10% to the amount collected and pays the total to the 501(c)(3) organizations. The total amount of donations received was $895,354 with total expenses to facilitate the program being $46,077. The total of 501(c)(3) charitable organizations that received funding through the Birdies for Charity program was 97 for a total donation amount of $1,261,496.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Uncertain Tax Positions Under FIN 48:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: The Organization has adopted the provisions of FASB Accounting Standards Codification Topic ASC 740-10 (previously Financial Interpretation No. 48, Accounting for Uncertainty in Income Taxes), on June 1, 2009. The implementation of this standard had no impact on the financial statements. As of both the date of adoption, and as of May 31, 2010, the unrecognized tax benefit accrual was zero. The organization will recognize future accrued interest and penalties related to unrecognized tax benefits in income tax expense if incurred. The organization is no longer subject to Federal tax examinations by tax authorities for years before 2007 and state examinations for years before 2006.

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: Procedure for Monitoring Grants in the U.S.:
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2: The organization only distributes funds to other 501(c)(3) organizations within the U.S. The organization monitors the effect its contributions have on the grantees. Grantees are asked to report back the benefits derived from the grant.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: Part I, Line 3: The Executive Director and other officers are compensated by a related organization that uses a combination of these methods.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 6
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Corporation's sole member shall be The Thunderbirds.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 7a
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The sole member, The Thunderbirds, elects the board of directors.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The draft Form 990 is reviewed by the CFO. Any questions or comments are addressed and then the draft Form 990 is provided to the governing body. Upon approval the Form 990 is filed.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The conflict of interest policy covers the board of directors and officers for Thunderbirds Charities. The remaining board members determine whether or not conflicts exist. If a conflict exists that member is asked to remove themselves from all discussions relevant to the conflict of interest. Periodic reviews are conducted by The Thunderbirds on various transactions entered into by Thunderbirds Charities.
Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15: These individuals are compensated by a related organization. That organization has a process for determining compensation.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19

GeneralExplanation.Explanation: This process has not changed from the prior year.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Part VII, Section A, Column (B) - Hours to Related Organizations:
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: John Bridger dedicated a total of 55 hours to the related organizations of The Thunderbirds, Thunderbird Foundation and Thunderbird Junior Golf Foundation. Marie Crouch dedicated a total of 40 hours to the related organizations of The Thunderbirds, Thunderbird Foundation and Thunderbird Junior Golf Foundation. Tim Louis,Shawn Parson, Jeff Lowe and Ed Beeh dedicated a total of 5 hours to the related organizations of The Thunderbirds, Thunderbird Foundation and Thunderbird Junior Golf Foundation. David Rauch dedicated a total of 15 hours to the related organizations of The Thunderbirds, Thunderbird Foundation and Thunderbird Junior Golf Foundation. John Felix dedicated a total of 13 hours to the related organizations of The Thunderbirds, Thunderbird Foundation and Thunderbird Junior Golf Foundation. Pat McGinley dedicated a total of 2.25 hours to the related organizations of The Thunderbirds, Thunderbird Foundation and Thunderbird Junior Golf Foundation. Steve Jordan, Guy Inzalaco and Paul Rhodes dedicated a total of .5 hours to the related organizations of The Thunderbirds, Thunderbird Foundation and Thunderbird Junior Golf Foundation.

Form990ScheduleRPartII.PrimaryActivities: Publicize Phoenix Metropolitan area by sponsoring athletic events
Provide affordable access to game of golf for children & youth
Support amateur athletes & athletic programs in Phoenix metropolitan area
